The intimate friendship which existed between Atticus and Cicero had 3 practical as well as a sentimental basis. Atticus found it profitable to act as Cicero's financial agent, and he found the letters of recommendation, which his friend wrote for him to the governors of provinces, of great service, while Cicero derived great profit from the advice and help which Atticus rendered him in domestic, political, literary‚ and financial matters. 59. In Cicero‘s time letters were commonly written either upon waxen tablets or papyrus.
